description: Continuation of STAT 101. A thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, linear logistic regression; introduction to time series. Business applications.
name: INTRO BUSINESS STAT

values.comments:
This course, a continuation of STAT 101, includes a thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, linear logistic regression; introduction to time series, and business applications. 

Students found this course “not very engaging” and not particularly helpful for learning the material or preparing for exams. Several students reported attending lectures infrequently or not at all, instead relying heavily on the TA-led review sessions, where they felt material was communicated more clearly. These review sessions were overwhelmingly emphasized as key to understanding the material and succeeding in the course. 

Students’ reviews of Professor Brown were mixed. One student described him as “sincere” and “endearingly funny” by one student, while another considered his teaching style “a bit scattered” and “rather confusing.” Various students agreed that Professor Brown’s ability to convey course concepts was limited. 

Some students noted that the exams were poorly worded and often quite dissimilar from the practice exams. According to one student, “There is no correlation between what is taught in class, what is on the homework, or what is on the test.”

This course, a continuation of STAT 101, includes a thorough treatment of multiple regression, model selection, analysis of variance, linear logistic regression; introduction to time series, and business applications. 

Most students agreed that the subject matter was interesting and useful, especially for “statisticians or businessmen,” and they learned “a lot of good concepts and ways of thinking.” Others, however, said that “it was very hard to pay attention during lectures.” Some students mentioned that lectures were difficult to understand and were a source of difficulty and confusion. 

Student opinion of Professor Zhao’s teaching ability was generally positive. Some students described Professor Zhao as a talented professor who “did a good job stimulating student interest.” Although “you can tell that the professor really loves to teach,” according to one student, others commented that Professor Zhao “sometimes does not communicate clearly” and “is not very open to answering questions.” 

This course comes with a heavy workload, and students complained that projects or long homework assignments were often assigned on the same week as a midterm or final. “The workload was by far the most of my classes this semester,” one student said. The teaching assistants, however, were an “amazing” resource for clarifying the material, and their review sessions were always “packed” with students.
